info.title: Smooch
info.description: The Smooch API is a unified interface for powering messaging in your customer experiences across every channel. Our API speeds access to new markets, reduces time to ship, eliminates complexity, and helps you build the best experiences for your customers. For more information, visit our [official documentation](https://docs.smooch.io).

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

post.description: Pre-create an app user.
Force the merge of two specific users, when the business has determined that they represent the same person.
Send an image message to the conversation.

parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

post.description: Link specified app user to given channel.

get.description: Get the specified app user's messages.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Timestamp of message. The API will return 100 messages before the specified timestamp (excluding any messages with the provided timestamp).

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Timestamp of message. The API will return 100 messages after the specified timestamp (excluding any messages with the provided timestamp).

post.description: Post a message to or from the app user.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

requestBody.description:
Body for a postMessage request.
Additional arguments are necessary based on message type ([text](https://docs.smooch.io/rest/#text), [image](https://docs.smooch.io/rest/#image), [carousel](https://docs.smooch.io/rest/#carousel), [list](https://docs.smooch.io/rest/#list), [form](https://docs.smooch.io/rest/#form))

delete.description: Clears the message history for a user, permanently deleting all messages, but leaving any connections to Messaging Channels and Business Systems intact. These connections allow for the conversation to continue in the future, while still being associated to the same appUser.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

post.description: Reset the unread count of the conversation to 0.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

post.description: Notify Smooch when an app maker starts or stops typing a response.

parameters.description: Identifies the user. Can be either the smoochId or the userId.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of initial records to skip before picking records to return.

post.description: Create a new service account.

get.description: List the secret keys for the specified service account.

post.description: Create a secret key for the specified service account.

delete.description: Delete the specified service account secret key.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of initial records to skip before picking records to return.

parameters.name: serviceAccountId
parameters.description: The service account ID for which to list apps.

get.description: List the secret keys for the specified app.

List integrations for the specified app.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description:
List of types to filter the query by.
More than one value can be specified through comma separation e.g. ?types=*twilio*,*line*.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of initial records to skip before picking records to return.

post.description: Create an integration for the specified app.

requestBody.description:
Body for a createIntegration request.
Additional arguments are necessary based on integration type. For detailed instructions, visit our [official docs](https://docs.smooch.io/rest/#create-integration)

Body for a updateIntegration request.
Additional arguments are necessary based on integration type. For detailed instructions, visit our [official docs](https://docs.smooch.io/rest/#update-integration)

post.description: Create the specified integration’s menu, overriding the app menu if configured.

put.description: Upload a photo to be used for the the specified integration’s profile.

get.description: List webhooks for the specified app.

post.description: Create a webhook for the specified app.
Upload an attachment to Smooch to use in future messages.

parameters.name: access
parameters.description: Access level for the resulting file

parameters.name: for
parameters.description: The intended container for the attachment

parameters.name: appUserId
parameters.description:
The appUserId of the user that will receive the attachment
Used in attachments for messages

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description:
The userId of the user that will receive the attachment
Used in attachments for messages

post.description: Remove an attachment uploaded to Smooch.

get.description: List templates for the specified app.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of initial records to skip before picking records to return.

post.description: Create a template for the specified app.
Create a WhatsApp deployment.
Activate a phone number on the specified deployment.
Confirm code to complete phone number activation.

_id.description: The app user's ID, generated automatically.

userId.description:
The app user's userId.
This ID is specified by the appMaker.

signedUpAt.description: A datetime string with the format *yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ* representing the moment an appUser was created.

properties.description: Custom properties for the app user.

conversationStarted.description: Flag indicating if the conversation has started for the app user.

clients.description: List of clients associated with the app user.

pendingClients.description: As clients, but containing linked clients which have not been confirmed yet (i.e. Twilio SMS).

id.description: An identifier for the client. Must be globally unique.

status.description: The client status. Indicates if the client is able to receive messages or not. See [**ClientStatusEnum**](Enums.md#ClientStatusEnum) for available values.

externalId.description: The ID of the user on an external channel. For example, the user's phone number for Twilio, or their page-scoped user ID for Facebook Messenger. Applies only to non-SDK clients.

active.description: Deprecated - use the status property instead.

lastSeen.description: The date time the client was last seen.

platform.description: The client's platform. See [**IntegrationTypeEnum**](Enums.md#IntegrationTypeEnum) for available values.

integrationId.description: The ID of the integration that the client was created for.

pushNotificationToken.description:
The GCM or APN token to be used for sending push notifications to the device.
Applies to only *android* and *ios* clients.

appVersion.description: A reserved string field for reporting the app version running on the device.

raw.description: An Object with raw properties that vary for each client platform. All keys are optional and not guaranteed to be available.

appName.description: Name of the app associated with the client.

isPaymentEnabled.description: Whether or not payment is enabled for client.

wifi.description: Whether or not the client has wifi.

signedUpAt.description: A datetime string with the format *yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ* representing the moment an appUser was created.

properties.description: Custom properties for the app user.

userId.description:
The app user's userId.
This ID is specified by the appMaker.

signedUpAt.description: A datetime string with the format *yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ* representing the moment an appUser was created.

properties.description: Custom properties for the app user.

_id.description: The `_id` of the user to merge.

authorId.description: The ID of the message's author.

role.description: The role of the individual posting the message. See [**RoleEnum**](Enums.md#RoleEnum) for available values.

type.description: The message type. See [**MessageTypeEnum**](Enums.md#MessageTypeEnum) for available values.

name.description: The display name of the message author.

text.description:
The message text.
Required for text messages.

email.description: The email address of the message author.

avatarUrl.description: The URL of the desired message avatar image.

received.description: The unix timestamp of the moment the message was received.

mediaUrl.description:
The mediaUrl for the message.
Required for image/file messages.

mediaType.description:
The mediaType for the message.
Required for image/file messages.

metadata.description: Flat JSON object containing any custom properties associated with the message.

items.description:
The items in the message list.
Required for carousel and list messages.

payload.description: The payload of a reply action, if applicable.

blockChatInput.description:
Indicates if the Web SDK chat input should be blocked. Defaults to false.
Only for form messages.

fields.description:
The fields in the form.
Required for form and formResponse messages.

submitted.description: Indicates if the form was submitted. Generated automatically.

textFallback.description:
The text fallback displayed in channels that do not support form messages.
Only for formResponse messages. Generated automatically.

id.description: An identifier used by Smooch for internal purposes.

type.description: An identifier for the channel from which a message originated. See [**IntegrationTypeEnum**](Enums.md#IntegrationTypeEnum) for available values.

originalMessageId.description: Message identifier assigned by the originating channel.

originalMessageTimestamp.description: Message timestamp assigned by the originating channel.

title.description: The title of the message item.

mediaUrl.description: The image URL to be shown in the carousel/list item.

size.description:
The size of the image to be shown in the carousel/list item.
Only top item of Facebook Messenger carousel supported. See [**MessageItemSizeEnum**](Enums.md#MessageItemSizeEnum) for available values.

mediaType.description: If a *mediaUrl* was specified, the media type is defined here, for example *image/jpeg*.

actions.description: Array of [action buttons](https://docs.smooch.io/rest/#action-buttons). At least 1 is required, a maximum of 3 are allowed.

type.description: The action type. See [**ActionTypeEnum**](Enums.md#ActionTypeEnum) for available values.

payload.description:
The payload to be sent with the resulting webhook.
Required for *postback* and *reply* actions.

metadata.description: Flat JSON object containing any custom properties associated with the action.

amount.description:
The amount being charged. It needs to be specified in cents and is an integer.
Required for *buy* actions.

currency.description: The currency of the amount being charged (USD, CAD, etc.).

default.description: Flag indicating if the message action is the default for a message item in Facebook Messenger.

iconUrl.description: An icon to render next to the reply option (Facebook Messenger and Web Messenger only).

uri.description:
The action URI. This is the link that will be used in the clients when clicking the button.
Required for *link* and *webview* actions.

fallback.description:
The webview action fallback uri. This is the link that will be used in clients that do not support webviews.
Required for *webview* actions.

size.description:
The size used to display the webview. Allowed values are ["compact", "tall", "full"].
(Optional) Used for *webview* actions. See [**ActionSizeEnum**](Enums.md#ActionSizeEnum) for available values.

extraChannelOptions.description: Extra options to pass directly to the channel API. See [Extra Channel Options](https://docs.smooch.io/rest#extra-channel-options-schema)

openOnReceive.description: Flag indicating if the webview should open automatically. Only one action per message can be set to true. Currently only supported on the Web Messenger.

imageAspectRatio.description: Specifies how to display all carousel images. See [**ImageAspectRatioEnum**](Enums.md#ImageAspectRatioEnum) for available values.

type.description: The field type. See [**FieldTypeEnum**](Enums.md#FieldTypeEnum) for available values.

name.description: The name of the field. Each field name must be unique per form.

label.description: The label to be displayed with the field.

placeholder.description:
The placeholder text of the field that will be rendered.
Only for form messages

minSize.description:
The minimum possible length of the response. Defaults to 1 if not specified.
Only for text fields in form messages.

maxSize.description:
The maximum possible length of the response. Defaults to 128 if not specified.
Only for text fields in form messages.

options.description:
The field options that can be selected. The array is limited to 20 options.
Only for select fields in form messages.

selectSize.description:
The select size, generated automatically.
Only for select fields in form messages.

text.description:
The text response to a text field.
Required for text fields in form response messages.

email.description:
The email response to an email field.
Required for email fields in form response messages.

select.description:
The options selected as a response to a select field.
Required for select fields in form response messages.

name.description: The name of the option. It must be unique per field.

label.description: The label the option will be displayed with on Web Messenger.

name.description: The name of the selected option.

label.description: The label of the selected option.

type.description: The quoted message type. See [**QuotedMessageTypeEnum**](Enums.md#QuotedMessageTypeEnum) for available values.

externalMessageId.description:
The external message Id of the quoted message.
Only for quoted messages with type set to externalMessageId.

lat.description: A floating point value representing the latitude of the location.

long.description: A floating point value representing the longitude of the location.

name.description: A name for the location.

unreadCount.description: The number of unread messages in the conversation.

channels.description: An array of objects containing the channel type and the entity id.

type.description: The type of channel. See [**IntegrationTypeEnum**](Enums.md#IntegrationTypeEnum) for available values.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number for a *twilio* or *messagebird* integration

userId.description: The userId for a *messenger*, *viber*, *line*, *wechat* or *twitter* integration

address.description: The email address for a *mailgun* integration

chatId.description: The chat id for a *telegram* integration

type.description: The type of the channel to link. See [**IntegrationTypeEnum**](Enums.md#IntegrationTypeEnum) for available values.

phoneNumber.description:
A String of the appUser’s phone number. It must contain the + prefix and the country code.
Required for *messenger*, *twilio*, *messagebird* and *whatsapp* linking.

address.description:
A String of the appUser’s email address.
Required for *mailgun* linking.

givenName.description:
A String of the appUser’s given name. Used as additional criteria to increase the likelihood of a match.
(Optional) Used for *messenger* linking.

surname.description:
A String of the appUser’s surname. Used as additional criteria to increase the likelihood of a match.
(Optional) Used for *messenger* linking.

subject.description:
Subject for the outgoing email.
(Optional) Used for *mailgun* linking.

type.description: The confirmation type. See [**ConfirmationTypeEnum**](Enums.md#ConfirmationTypeEnum) for available values.

businessSystems.description: An array of objects containing the business system type and the id.

type.description: The type of business system. See [**BusinessSystemTypeEnum**](Enums.md#BusinessSystemTypeEnum) for available values.

channelId.description: The channel id for a *slack* integration

ticketId.description: The ticket id for a *zendesk* integration

roomId.description: The room id for a *hipchat* integration

conversationId.description: The conversation id for a *helpscout* integration

next.description: The URI for the next set of messages in the conversation.

role.description: The role of the individual posting the message. See [**RoleEnum**](Enums.md#RoleEnum) for available values.

type.description: The message type. See [**MessageTypeEnum**](Enums.md#MessageTypeEnum) for available values.

name.description: The display name of the message author.

email.description: The email address of the message author.

avatarUrl.description: The URL of the desired message avatar image.

metadata.description: Flat JSON object containing any custom properties associated with the message.

payload.description: The payload of a reply action, if applicable.

text.description:
The message text.
Required for text messages.

mediaUrl.description:
The mediaUrl for the message.
Required for image/file messages.

mediaType.description:
The mediaType for the message.
Required for image/file messages.

items.description:
The items in the message list.
Required for carousel and list messages.

blockChatInput.description:
Indicates if the Web SDK chat input should be blocked. Defaults to false.
Only for form messages.

fields.description:
The fields in the form.
Required for form messages.

type.description: The field type. See [**FieldTypeEnum**](Enums.md#FieldTypeEnum) for available values.

name.description: The name of the field. Each field name must be unique per form.

label.description: The label to be displayed with the field.

placeholder.description:
The placeholder text of the field that will be rendered.
Only for form messages

minSize.description:
The minimum possible length of the response. Defaults to 1 if not specified.
Only for text fields in form messages.

maxSize.description:
The maximum possible length of the response. Defaults to 128 if not specified.
Only for text fields in form messages.

options.description:
The field options that can be selected. The array is limited to 20 options.
Only for select fields in form messages.

integrationId.description: The ID of the target integration.

integrationType.description: The type of the target integration. See [**IntegrationTypeEnum**](Enums.md#IntegrationTypeEnum) for available values.

role.description: The role of the actor. Must be *appMaker*. See [**RoleEnum**](Enums.md#RoleEnum) for available values.

type.description: The type of activity to trigger. Must be either *typing:start* or *typing:stop*. See [**MessageTypeEnum**](Enums.md#MessageTypeEnum) for available values.

name.description: The name of the app maker that starts or stops typing a response.

avatarUrl.description: The avatar URL of the app maker that starts typing a response.

text.description: The button text of the menu item.

uri.description: A valid address, like http://smooch.io. Required for a link type item.

type.description: Can either be link, postback, which correspond to Smooch’s link and postback actions, or submenu for nested menus. See [**MenuItemTypeEnum**](Enums.md#MenuItemTypeEnum) for available values.

payload.description: A payload for a postback. Required for a postback type item.

items.description: A list of menu items for a submenu.

text.description: The button text of the menu item.

uri.description: A valid address, like http://smooch.io. Required for a link type item.

type.description: Can either be link, postback, which correspond to Smooch’s link and postback actions, or submenu for nested menus. See [**MenuItemTypeEnum**](Enums.md#MenuItemTypeEnum) for available values.

payload.description: A payload for a postback. Required for a postback type item.

hasMore.description: Flag indicating if there are more service accounts that are not present in the response.

offset.description: The number of service account records skipped in the returned list.

name.description: The service account's name.
The service account's name.
The service account's name.

_id.description: The secret key ID, generated automatically.

name.description: A friendly identifier for the secret key.
A friendly identifier for the secret key.

hasMore.description: Flag indicating if there are more apps that are not present in the response.

offset.description: The number of app records skipped in the returned list.

appToken.description: The appToken, used to initialize the Web, iOS and Android clients and to make calls to the app user facing API.

name.description: The app's name.

metadata.description: Flat JSON object containing any custom properties associated with the app.

name.description: The app's name.

metadata.description: Flat JSON object containing any custom properties associated with the app.

name.description: The app's name.

metadata.description: Flat JSON object containing any custom properties associated with the app.

hasMore.description: Flag indicating if there are more integrations that are not present in the response.

offset.description: The number of integration records skipped in the returned list.

type.description: The integration type. See [**IntegrationTypeEnum**](Enums.md#IntegrationTypeEnum) for available values.

displayName.description:
The integration display name.
Used to map a human-friendly name to an integration.

pageAccessToken.description:
Facebook Page Access Token.
Required for *messenger* integrations.

appId.description:
Facebook App ID OR WeChat App ID.
Required for *messenger* and *wechat* integrations.

appSecret.description:
Facebook Page App Secret OR WeChat App Secret.
Required for *messenger* and *wechat* integrations.

accessTokenUrl.description:
Optional endpoint to generate access tokens for WeChat.
Used to coordinate API access with third party systems.

webhookSecret.description:
Secret to verify webhooks.
Returned on successful *wechat* and *messagebird* integrations.

pageId.description:
Facebook Page App ID.
Returned on successful *messenger* integrations.

accountSid.description:
Twilio Account SID.
Required for *twilio* integrations.

authToken.description:
Twilio Auth Token.
Required for *twilio* integrations.

phoneNumberSid.description:
SID for specific phone number.
Required for *twilio* integrations.

phoneNumber.description:
Smooch will receive all messages sent to this phone number.
Returned on successful *twilio* integrations.

name.description:
Name on the account.
Returned on successful *twilio* integrations.

token.description:
Telegram Bot Token OR Viber Public Account token.
Required for *twilio* and *viber* integrations.

uri.description:
The viber URI to find the account.
Returned on successful *viber* integrations.

channelId.description:
LINE Channel ID.
Required for *line* integrations.

channelSecret.description:
LINE Channel Secret.
Required for *line* integrations.

channelAccessToken.description:
LINE Channel Access Token.
Required for *line* integrations.

qrCodeUrl.description: URL provided by LINE in the [Developer Console](https://developers.line.biz/console/).

lineId.description: LINE Basic ID. Generated automatically when a `qrCodeUrl` is updated.

botName.description:
The bot's name.
Returned on successful *line* integrations.

encodingAesKey.description:
AES Encoding Key.
(Optional) Used for *wechat* integrations.

fromAddress.description:
Email will display as coming from this address.
(Optional) Used for *frontendEmail* integrations.

certificate.description:
The binary of your APN certificate base64 encoded.
Required for *apn* integrations.

deploymentId.description:
Your WhatsApp deployment ID.
Required for *WhatsApp* integrations.

baseUrl.description:
Your WhatsApp API client's URL.
Required for *WhatsApp* integrations. (this usage is deprecated)

hsmFallbackLanguage.description:
Specification of a fallback language.
(Optional) Used for *WhatsApp* integrations.

password.description:
The password for your APN certificate or WhatsApp API client.
Required for *WhatsApp* integrations. (this usage is deprecated)
(Optional) Used for *apn* integrations.

autoUpdateBadge.description:
Use the unread count of the conversation as the application badge.
(Optional) Used for *apn* integrations.

production.description:
Flag specifying whether the certificate is production.
Returned on successful *apn* integrations.

serverKey.description:
Your server key from the fcm console.
Required for *fcm* integrations.

senderId.description:
Your sender id from the fcm console.
Required for *fcm* integrations.

tier.description: Your Twitter app’s tier. Accepted values are enterprise or premium.

envName.description:
The Twitter environment name, e.g.: env-beta.
Required for *twitter* integrations with *premium* tier.

consumerKey.description:
The consumer key for your Twitter app.
Required for *twitter* integrations.

consumerSecret.description:
The consumer secret for your Twitter app.
Required for *twitter* integrations.

accessTokenKey.description:
The access token key obtained from your user via oauth.
Required for *twitter* integrations.

accessTokenSecret.description:
The access token secret obtained from your user via oauth.
Required for *twitter* integrations.

userId.description:
The twitter userId.
Returned on successful *twitter* integrations.

username.description:
The username for the account.
Returned on successful *twitter* and *telegram* integrations.
Required for *WhatsApp* integrations. (this usage is deprecated)

apiKey.description:
The public API key of your Mailgun account.
Required for *mailgun* integrations.

domain.description:
The domain used to relay email.
Required for *mailgun* integrations.

incomingAddress.description:
Smooch will receive all emails sent to this address.
Required for *mailgun* integrations.

accessKey.description:
The public API key of your MessageBird account.
Required for *messagebird* integrations.

originator.description:
Smooch will receive all messages sent to this phone number.
Required for *messagebird* integrations.

brandColor.description:
This color will be used in the messenger header and the button or tab in idle state.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

fixedIntroPane.description:
When `true`, the introduction pane will be pinned at the top of the conversation instead of scrolling with it. The default value is `false`.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

conversationColor.description:
This color will be used for customer messages, quick replies and actions in the footer.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

actionColor.description:
This color will be used for call-to-actions inside your messages.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

displayStyle.description:
Choose how the messenger will appear on your website. Must be either button or tab.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

buttonIconUrl.description:
With the button style Web Messenger, you have the option of selecting your own button icon.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

buttonWidth.description:
With the button style Web Messenger, you have the option of specifying its width.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

buttonHeight.description:
With the button style Web Messenger, you have the option of specifying its height.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

integrationOrder.description:
Array of integration IDs, order will be reflected in the Web Messenger.
When set, only integrations from this list will be displayed in the Web Messenger.
If unset, all integrations will be displayed
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

businessName.description:
A custom business name for the Web Messenger.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

businessIconUrl.description:
A custom business icon url for the Web Messenger.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

backgroundImageUrl.description:
A custom background url for the Web Messenger.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

originWhitelist.description:
A list of origins to whitelist.
When set, only the origins from this list will be able to initialize the Web Messenger.
If unset, all origins are whitelisted.
The elements in the list should follow the serialized-origin format from RFC 6454 `scheme "://" host [ ":" port ]`, where scheme is `http` or `https`.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

hideUnsubscribeLink.description:
When `true`, unsubscribe links will not be included in outbound emails. If this setting is enabled, it is expected that the business is providing the user a way to unsubscribe by some other means.
(Optional) Used for *mailgun* integrations.

status.description: The integration status. See [**IntegrationStatusEnum**](Enums.md#IntegrationStatusEnum) for available values. [More info](https://docs.smooch.io/#integration-status).

error.description: The error causing the integration to fail. Will be present when `status` is 'error'.

type.description: The integration type. See [**IntegrationTypeEnum**](Enums.md#IntegrationTypeEnum) for available values.

displayName.description:
The integration display name.
Used to map a human-friendly name to an integration.

pageAccessToken.description:
Facebook Page Access Token.
Required for *messenger* integrations.

appId.description:
Facebook App ID OR WeChat App ID.
Required for *messenger* and *wechat* integrations.

appSecret.description:
Facebook Page App Secret OR WeChat App Secret.
Required for *messenger* and *wechat* integrations.

accountSid.description:
Twilio Account SID.
Required for *twilio* integrations.

authToken.description:
Twilio Auth Token.
Required for *twilio* integrations.

baseUrl.description:
Your WhatsApp API client's URL.
Required for *WhatsApp* integrations. (this usage is deprecated)

hsmFallbackLanguage.description:
Specification of a fallback language.
(Optional) Used for *WhatsApp* integrations.

phoneNumberSid.description:
SID for specific phone number.
Required for *twilio* integrations.

token.description:
Telegram Bot Token OR Viber Public Account token.
Required for *twilio* and *viber* integrations.

channelId.description:
LINE Channel ID.
Required for *line* integrations.

channelSecret.description:
LINE Channel Secret.
Required for *line* integrations.

channelAccessToken.description:
LINE Channel Access Token.
Required for *line* integrations.

deploymentId.description:
Your WhatsApp deployment ID.
Required for *WhatsApp* integrations.

encodingAesKey.description:
AES Encoding Key.
(Optional) Used for *wechat* integrations.

fromAddress.description:
Email will display as coming from this address.
(Optional) Used for *frontendEmail* integrations.

certificate.description:
The binary of your APN certificate base64 encoded.
Required for *apn* integrations.

password.description:
The password for your APN certificate or WhatsApp API client.
Required for *WhatsApp* integrations. (this usage is deprecated)
(Optional) Used for *apn* integrations.

username.description:
The username for the account.
Returned on successful *twitter* and *telegram* integrations.
Required for *WhatsApp* integrations. (this usage is deprecated)

autoUpdateBadge.description:
Use the unread count of the conversation as the application badge.
(Optional) Used for *apn* integrations.

serverKey.description:
Your server key from the fcm console.
Required for *fcm* integrations.

senderId.description:
Your sender id from the fcm console.
Required for *fcm* integrations.

tier.description: Your Twitter app’s tier. Accepted values are enterprise or premium.

envName.description:
The Twitter environment name, e.g.: env-beta.
Required for *twitter* integrations with *premium* tier.

consumerKey.description:
The consumer key for your Twitter app.
Required for *twitter* integrations.

consumerSecret.description:
The consumer secret for your Twitter app.
Required for *twitter* integrations.

accessTokenKey.description:
The access token key obtained from your user via oauth.
Required for *twitter* integrations.

accessTokenSecret.description:
The access token secret obtained from your user via oauth.
Required for *twitter* integrations.

accessTokenUrl.description:
Optional endpoint to generate access tokens for WeChat.
Used to coordinate API access with third party systems.

accessKey.description:
The public API key of your MessageBird account.
Required for *messagebird* integrations.

originator.description:
Smooch will receive all messages sent to this phone number.
Required for *messagebird* integrations.

brandColor.description:
This color will be used in the messenger header and the button or tab in idle state.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

fixedIntroPane.description:
When `true`, the introduction pane will be pinned at the top of the conversation instead of scrolling with it. The default value is `false`.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

conversationColor.description:
This color will be used for customer messages, quick replies and actions in the footer.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

actionColor.description:
This color will be used for call-to-actions inside your messages.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

displayStyle.description:
Choose how the messenger will appear on your website. Must be either button or tab.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

buttonIconUrl.description:
With the button style Web Messenger, you have the option of selecting your own button icon.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

buttonWidth.description:
With the button style Web Messenger, you have the option of specifying its width.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

buttonHeight.description:
With the button style Web Messenger, you have the option of specifying its height.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

integrationOrder.description:
Array of integration IDs, order will be reflected in the Web Messenger.
When set, only integrations from this list will be displayed in the Web Messenger.
If unset, all integrations will be displayed
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

businessName.description:
A custom business name for the Web Messenger.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

businessIconUrl.description:
A custom business icon url for the Web Messenger.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

backgroundImageUrl.description:
A custom background url for the Web Messenger.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

originWhitelist.description:
A list of origins to whitelist.
When set, only the origins from this list will be able to initialize the Web Messenger.
If unset, all origins are whitelisted.
The elements in the list should follow the serialized-origin format from RFC 6454 `scheme "://" host [ ":" port ]`, where scheme is `http` or `https`.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

qrCodeUrl.description: URL provided by LINE in the [Developer Console](https://developers.line.biz/console/).

hideUnsubscribeLink.description:
When `true`, unsubscribe links will not be included in outbound emails. If this setting is enabled, it is expected that the business is providing the user a way to unsubscribe by some other means.
(Optional) Used for *mailgun* integrations.

displayName.description:
The integration display name.
Used to map a human-friendly name to an integration.

brandColor.description:
This color will be used in the messenger header and the button or tab in idle state.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

fixedIntroPane.description:
When `true`, the introduction pane will be pinned at the top of the conversation instead of scrolling with it. The default value is `false`.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

conversationColor.description:
This color will be used for customer messages, quick replies and actions in the footer.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

actionColor.description:
This color will be used for call-to-actions inside your messages.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

displayStyle.description:
Choose how the messenger will appear on your website. Must be either button or tab.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

buttonIconUrl.description:
With the button style Web Messenger, you have the option of selecting your own button icon.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

buttonWidth.description:
With the button style Web Messenger, you have the option of specifying its width.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

buttonHeight.description:
With the button style Web Messenger, you have the option of specifying its height.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

integrationOrder.description:
Array of integration IDs, order will be reflected in the Web Messenger.
When set, only integrations from this list will be displayed in the Web Messenger.
If unset, all integrations will be displayed
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

businessName.description:
A custom business name for the Web Messenger.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

businessIconUrl.description:
A custom business icon url for the Web Messenger.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

backgroundImageUrl.description:
A custom background url for the Web Messenger.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

originWhitelist.description:
A list of origins to whitelist.
When set, only the origins from this list will be able to initialize the Web Messenger.
If unset, all origins are whitelisted.
The elements in the list should follow the serialized-origin format from RFC 6454 `scheme "://" host [ ":" port ]`, where scheme is `http` or `https`.
(Optional) Used for *Web Messenger* integrations.

channelId.description:
LINE Channel ID.
Required for *line* integrations.

channelSecret.description:
LINE Channel Secret.
Required for *line* integrations.

hsmFallbackLanguage.description:
Specification of a fallback language.
(Optional) Used for *WhatsApp* integrations.

qrCodeUrl.description: URL provided by LINE in the [Developer Console](https://developers.line.biz/console/).

hideUnsubscribeLink.description:
When `true`, unsubscribe links will not be included in outbound emails. If this setting is enabled, it is expected that the business is providing the user a way to unsubscribe by some other means.
(Optional) Used for *mailgun* integrations.

profile.description: JSON object containing the integration profile. [More info](https://docs.smooch.io/rest/#get-integration-profile)

about.description: Text to display in your profile's About section. Can be used as a status update. Maximum of 139 characters.

address.description: Address of the business. Maximum of 256 characters.

description.description: Description of the business. Maximum of 256 characters.

email.description: Email address to contact the business. Maximum of 128 characters.

photoUrl.description: URL where the business' profile photo is hosted. WhatsApp recommends an image with dimensions of 640x640 and max size of 63KB.

vertical.description: Industry of the business. Maximum of 128 characters.

websites.description: URLs associated with the business. Maximum of 2 websites.

target.description: URL to be called when the webhook is triggered.

triggers.description: An array of triggers you wish to have the webhook listen to. See [**WebhookTriggersEnum**](Enums.md#WebhookTriggersEnum) for available values.

secret.description: Secret which will be transmitted with each webhook invocation and can be used to verify the authenticity of the caller.

version.description: The payload version of the webhook.

includeClient.description: Specifies whether webhook payloads should include the client information associated with a conversation in webhook events.

includeFullAppUser.description: Specifies whether webhook payloads should include the complete appUser schema for appUser events.

target.description: URL to be called when the webhook is triggered.

triggers.description: An array of triggers you wish to have the webhook listen to. See [**WebhookTriggersEnum**](Enums.md#WebhookTriggersEnum) for available values.

includeClient.description: Specifies whether webhook payloads should include the client information associated with a conversation in webhook events.

includeFullAppUser.description: Specifies whether webhook payloads should include the complete appUser schema for appUser events.

target.description: URL to be called when the webhook is triggered.

triggers.description: An array of triggers you wish to have the webhook listen to. See [**WebhookTriggersEnum**](Enums.md#WebhookTriggersEnum) for available values.

includeClient.description: Specifies whether webhook payloads should include the client information associated with a conversation in webhook events.

includeFullAppUser.description: Specifies whether webhook payloads should include the complete appUser schema for appUser events.

mediaUrl.description:
The mediaUrl for the message.
Required for image/file messages.

mediaType.description:
The mediaType for the message.
Required for image/file messages.

mediaUrl.description:
The mediaUrl for the message.
Required for image/file messages.

hasMore.description: Flag indicating if there are more templates that are not present in the response.

offset.description: The number of template records skipped in the returned list.

name.description: The name for the template, used when sending via [shorthand](https://docs.smooch.io/guide/shorthand/#sending-template-message-with-inline-syntax).
The name for the template, used when sending via [shorthand](https://docs.smooch.io/guide/shorthand/#sending-template-message-with-inline-syntax).
The name for the template, used when sending via [shorthand](https://docs.smooch.io/guide/shorthand/#sending-template-message-with-inline-syntax).

status.description: The deployment status. See [**DeploymentStatusEnum**](Enums.md#DeploymentStatusEnum) for available values.

hosting.description: The deployment hosting. See [**DeploymentHostingEnum**](Enums.md#DeploymentHostingEnum) for available values.

baseUrl.description: The baseUrl of the deployment. Only present for `self` hosted deployments.

username.description: The username of the deployment. Only present for `self` hosted deployments.

phoneNumber.description: The phoneNumber of the deployment. Only present once the deployment has been registered.

callbackUrl.description: The URL to be called by Smooch when the status of the deployment changes.

callbackSecret.description: The secret used to secure the callback.

integrationId.description: The integrationId of the integration using this deployment.

appId.description: The appId of the integration using this deployment.

hosting.description: The deployment hosting. See [**DeploymentHostingEnum**](Enums.md#DeploymentHostingEnum) for available values.

baseUrl.description: The base URL to access your WhatsApp EC. Only provide for `self` hosted deployments.

username.description: The username to access your WhatsApp EC. Only provide for `self` hosted deployments.

password.description: The password to access your WhatsApp EC. Only provide for `self` hosted deployments.

callbackUrl.description: The URL to be called by Smooch when the status of the deployment changes.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number to send the activation code to.

verifiedNameCertificate.description: The verified name certificate for the phone number.

method.description: The method desired to receive the activation code. See [**DeploymentActivationMethodEnum**](Enums.md#DeploymentActivationMethodEnum) for available values.

code.description: The code that was sent to you via SMS or phone call.

type.description: The integration type. See [**IntegrationTypeEnum**](Enums.md#IntegrationTypeEnum) for available values.

payload.description: The exact payload to send to WhatsApp.

maskCreditCardNumbers.description: Flag specifying whether credit card numbers will be automatically masked if sent through Smooch.

useAnimalNames.description: Flag specifying whether animal names should be used for anonymous users.

conversationRetentionSeconds.description: Number of seconds of inactivity before a conversation’s messages will be automatically deleted.

echoPostback.description: A boolean specifying whether a message should be added to the conversation history when a postback button is clicked.
